story_outline.scene_title: Introduction: The NAMCS Health Center Ecosystem
story_outline.narrative_purpose: Set the context by introducing the key players, concepts, and relationships in the NAMCS HC Component ecosystem. Show how FQHCs, NCHS, HRSA, and PCOR are interconnected.
story_outline.notes: Force-directed graph showing relationships between organizations (NCHS, HRSA, HUD), data systems (NAMCS, UDS, EHR), and concepts (PCOR, FQHCs, HPSAs). This provides a bird's-eye view of the entire ecosystem.

story_outline.narrative_purpose: Highlight the critical role of FQHCs in serving underserved populations and the stark differences between FQHC patients and the general U.S. population.
story_outline.notes: Compare FQHC patient demographics vs U.S. population (31.3M patients, 67.3% poverty vs 11.1% national). Show the scale and impact of FQHCs in addressing health disparities.

story_outline.narrative_purpose: Explain the four-step data collection methodology and sampling strategy that enables nationally representative data collection.
story_outline.notes: Visualize the 4-step process: (1) Contact & Agreement, (2) Questionnaire, (3) HL7 Implementation, (4) T&V and Submission. Include sampling funnel: 1,400 frame → 50 primary → 29 participating.

story_outline.narrative_purpose: Illustrate the dual-track data access model with restricted and public use datafiles, showing what researchers can access at each level.
story_outline.notes: Tree diagram branching from NAMCS HC Component to Restricted (full data, RDC access, fee required) and Public Use (5% sample, free, fewer variables). Include data element comparison.

story_outline.narrative_purpose: Demonstrate the analytical power of the data through maternal health visit patterns across age groups.
story_outline.notes: Age-based comparison matrix showing maternal health visit rates and gestational diabetes rates. Highlight significant differences between age groups (20-29: 134.6 vs 12-19: 29.7).

story_outline.narrative_purpose: Reveal racial/ethnic disparities in respiratory disease visits over time, demonstrating the dashboard's analytical capabilities.
story_outline.notes: Time-series from Jan 2022 to June 2024 showing respiratory visit rates by race/ethnicity. Non-Hispanic White (10.3-14.3) vs Hispanic (25.6-31.9) vs Non-Hispanic Black (24.1-36.8).

story_outline.narrative_purpose: Show how linking NAMCS HC data to external sources (HUD) creates new research possibilities for understanding social determinants of health.
story_outline.notes: Sankey diagram showing flow from NAMCS HC patients (727K) through linkage eligibility (99.9%) to HUD programs (HCV, PH, MF). Show demographic breakdown of linked patients.

story_outline.narrative_purpose: Visualize the dramatic growth of the NAMCS HC Component in participating centers and visit records.
story_outline.notes: Growth timeline: 2021 (29 centers, 3.5M visits) → 2022 (64 centers, 5.6M visits) → 2023 (95 centers, 9M visits). Emphasize 98.4% retention rate.

story_outline.narrative_purpose: Present the survey's limitations transparently while showing mitigation strategies.
story_outline.notes: Matrix showing limitations (response rate, data availability, missingness) paired with mitigation strategies (retention, normalization, ongoing expansion).

story_outline.narrative_purpose: Summarize key achievements and outline future directions including planned data linkages and expanded capabilities.
story_outline.notes: Roadmap tree showing current achievements branching into future plans: 2024 datafiles, NDI linkage (complete), HUD linkage (complete), T-MSIS linkage (underway), expanded visualizations.
